e4: Switching to the new policy ensures that financial reports are accurate and unbiased, which aligns with ethical standards and reduces legal risk. This transparency builds trust with all investors and avoids misleading any parties. Additionally, it eliminates the advantage of savvy investors at the expense of retail investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, unbiased, and truthful, ensuring all investors have accurate information. It should comply with legal standards and protect investor interests, especially retail investors. Ethical policies also promote fair market practices, uphold the company’s reputation, and foster trust in management by eliminating deliberate biases or misleading figures.
e6: What strategies does management have in place to effectively communicate the change in reporting policy to all investors, ensuring that there is no misunderstanding or disadvantage to retail investors? Additionally, how will management monitor investor response and market impact after implementing the new policy to address any emerging issues?
